p: Similar studies on sera from clinically normal seropositive Canadian harp and hooded seals showed that harp seal sera reacted similarly to that of grey seals [ 12]. Significantly more harp seal sera (18 of 20) precipitated N, F and H glycoproteins that those of hooded seals (7 of 20) while three seropositive ringed seal ( Pusa hispida) sera precipitated N and F [ 12]. Thus, species differences in humoral immune response may be an important determinant in PDV susceptibility.
